arabic_text: وَٱلطُّورِ

translations.english_saheeh: By the mount
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. By the Tûr (Mount)
translations.english_rwwad: By the mount of Tūr,

arabic_text: وَكِتَٰبٖ مَّسۡطُورٖ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1550]- Interpreted as the Preserved Slate or possibly the Qur’ān.

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] a Book inscribed[1550]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by a Book Inscribed
translations.english_rwwad: and by the Book inscribed

arabic_text: فِي رَقّٖ مَّنشُورٖ

translations.english_saheeh: In parchment spread open
translations.english_hilali_khan: In parchment unrolled.
translations.english_rwwad: on an unrolled parchment,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡبَيۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡمُورِ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1551]- The house of worship for the angels in the seventh heaven, comparable to the Kaʿbah on earth.

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the frequented House[1551]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by Al-Bait-ul-Ma‘mûr[2] (the house over the heavens parallel to the Ka‘bah at Makkah, continuously visited by the angels).
translations.english_rwwad: and by the much-frequented House [in heaven],

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّقۡفِ ٱلۡمَرۡفُوعِ

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the ceiling [i.e., heaven] raised high
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the roof raised high (i.e. the heaven).
translations.english_rwwad: and by the canopy raised high,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡبَحۡرِ ٱلۡمَسۡجُورِ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1552]- On the Day of Resurrection.  Or "the sea which has overflowed."

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the sea set on fire,[1552]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the sea kept filled (or it will be fire kindled on the Day of Resurrection).
translations.english_rwwad: and by the sea ever filled.

arabic_text: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَٰقِعٞ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will occur.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, the Torment of your Lord will surely come to pass.
translations.english_rwwad: The punishment of your Lord will surely come to pass;

arabic_text: مَّا لَهُۥ مِن دَافِعٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Of it there is no preventer.
translations.english_hilali_khan: There is none that can avert it.
translations.english_rwwad: there is none who can avert it.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تَمُورُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ مَوۡرٗا

translations.english_saheeh: On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion
translations.english_hilali_khan: On the Day when the heaven will shake with a dreadful shaking,
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when the heaven will convulse violently,

arabic_text: وَتَسِيرُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ سَيۡرٗا

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1553]- Becoming dust and moving as clouds.

translations.english_saheeh: And the mountains will pass on, departing[1553] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the mountains will move away with a (horrible) movement.
translations.english_rwwad: and the mountains will move a horrible movement,

arabic_text: فَوَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then woe that Day to the beliers.[3]
translations.english_rwwad: then woe to the deniers on that Day,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي خَوۡضٖ يَلۡعَبُونَ

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.52:12) Busy in disbelief and evil deeds in this world, that are trials (for mankind), and they are ignoring their eternal end (i.e. punishment in the Fire of Hell, forever).

translations.english_saheeh: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who are playing in falsehood[4].
translations.english_rwwad: those who amuse themselves in falsehood.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا

translations.english_saheeh: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day when they will be pushed down by force to the Fire of Hell, with a horrible, forceful pushing.
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when they will be shoved into the Fire forcefully,

arabic_text: هَٰذِهِ ٱلنَّارُ ٱلَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
phonetic: 52.14 Hadhihi An-Nāru Allatī Kuntum Bihā Tukadhibūna

translations.english_saheeh: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.
translations.english_hilali_khan: This is the Fire which you used to belie.
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be told,] “This is the Fire which you used to deny.

arabic_text: أَفَسِحۡرٌ هَٰذَآ أَمۡ أَنتُمۡ لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Then is this magic, or do you not see?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is this magic, or do you not see?
translations.english_rwwad: Is this [punishment] magic, or do you not see?

arabic_text: ٱصۡلَوۡهَا فَٱصۡبِرُوٓاْ أَوۡ لَا تَصۡبِرُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ إِنَّمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
phonetic: 52.16 Aşlawhā Fāşbirū 'Aw Lā Taşbirū Sawā'un `Alaykum 'Innamā Tujzawna Mā Kuntum Ta`malūna

translations.english_saheeh: [Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Taste you therein its heat and whether you are patient of it or impatient of it, it is all the same. You are only being requited for what you used to do.
translations.english_rwwad: Burn in it, whether you bear it patiently or impatiently, it makes no difference to you; you are recompensed only for what you used to do.”

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَعِيمٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,
translations.english_hilali_khan: will be in Gardens (Paradise), and Delight.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and bliss,

arabic_text: فَٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ وَوَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
phonetic: 52.18 Fākihīna Bimā 'Ātāhum Rabbuhum Wa Waqāhum Rabbuhum `Adhāba Al-Jaĥīmi

translations.english_saheeh: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Enjoying in that which their Lord has bestowed on them, and (the fact that) their Lord saved them from the torment of the blazing Fire.
translations.english_rwwad: enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
phonetic: 52.19 Kulū Wa Ashrabū Hanī'āan Bimā Kuntum Ta`malūna

translations.english_saheeh: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Eat and drink with happiness because of what you used to do."
translations.english_rwwad: “Eat and drink pleasantly for what you used to do,

arabic_text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّصۡفُوفَةٖۖ وَزَوَّجۡنَٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٖ
phonetic: 52.20 Muttaki'īna `Alá Sururin Maşfūfatin Wa Zawwajnāhum Biĥūrin `Īnin

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.52:20) Hûr. Very fair females created by Allah as such, not from the offspring of Adam عليه السلام with intense black irises of their eyes and intense white scleras. See the footnote of (V.44:54)

translations.english_saheeh: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will recline (with ease) on thrones arranged in ranks. And We shall marry them to Hûr: (female, fair ones) with wide lovely eyes.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: reclining on lined up couches”. And We will marry them to houris of wide beautiful eyes.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَٱتَّبَعَتۡهُمۡ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَٰنٍ أَلۡحَقۡنَا بِهِمۡ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمۡ وَمَآ أَلَتۡنَٰهُم مِّنۡ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيۡءٖۚ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيِٕۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٞ
phonetic: 52.21 Wa Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Wa Attaba`at/hum Dhurrīyatuhum Bi'īmānin 'Alĥaqnā Bihim Dhurrīyatahum Wa Mā 'Alatnāhum Min `Amalihim Min Shay'in Kullu Amri'in Bimā Kasaba Rahīnun

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1554]- i.e., the reward thereof.
[1555]- i.e., subject or held responsible.  Literally, "a hostage."

translations.english_saheeh: And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds.[1554] Every person, for what he earned, is retained.[1555]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those who believe and whose offspring follow them in Faith: to them shall We join their offspring, and We shall not decrease the reward of their deeds in anything. Every person is a pledge for that which he has earned.
translations.english_rwwad: As for those who believe and their offspring follow them in faith, We will cause their offspring to join them, and will not detract anything from [the reward of] their deeds. Everyone will be accountable for what he earned.

arabic_text: وَأَمۡدَدۡنَٰهُم بِفَٰكِهَةٖ وَلَحۡمٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ
phonetic: 52.22 Wa 'Amdadnāhum Bifākihatin Wa Laĥmin Mimmā Yashtahūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We shall provide them with fruit and meat such as they desire.
translations.english_rwwad: And We will provide them with whatever fruit and meat they desire.

arabic_text: يَتَنَٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا لَّا لَغۡوٞ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمٞ
phonetic: 52.23 Yatanāza`ūna Fīhā Ka'sāan Lā Laghwun Fīhā Wa Lā Ta'thīmun

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.52:23) See Footnote b, c and d of (V.2:219).

translations.english_saheeh: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.
translations.english_hilali_khan: There they shall pass from hand to hand a (wine) cup, free from any Laghw (dirty, false, evil vain talk between them), and free from sin[2] (because it will be lawful for them to drink).
translations.english_rwwad: They will pass around to one another a glass [of pure wine] which does not lead to idle talk or sin.

arabic_text: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ غِلۡمَانٞ لَّهُمۡ كَأَنَّهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٞ مَّكۡنُونٞ
phonetic: 52.24 Wa Yaţūfu `Alayhim Ghilmānun Lahum Ka'annahum Lu'ulu'uun Maknūnun

translations.english_saheeh: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And there will go round boy-servants of theirs, to serve them as if they were preserved pearls.
translations.english_rwwad: They will be served by their servant boys, as if they were well-protected pearls.

arabic_text: وَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And some of them draw near to others, questioning.
translations.english_rwwad: They will turn to one another with questions.

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبۡلُ فِيٓ أَهۡلِنَا مُشۡفِقِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Saying: "Aforetime, we were afraid (of the punishment of Allâh) in the midst of our families.
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “Before this, we used to be in awe [of Allah] when we were living among our people.

arabic_text: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ

translations.english_saheeh: So Allāh conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So Allâh has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of the Fire.
translations.english_rwwad: Therefore Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

arabic_text: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبۡلُ نَدۡعُوهُۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
phonetic: 52.28 'Innā Kunnā Min Qablu Nad`ūhu 'Innahu Huwa Al-Barru Ar-Raĥīmu

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, we used to supplicate[1556] Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily, We used to invoke Him (Alone and none else) before. Verily, He is Al-Barr (the Most Subtle, Kind, Courteous, and Generous), the Most Merciful."[3]
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, we used to call upon Him before. He is indeed the Most Kind, the Most Merciful.”

arabic_text: فَذَكِّرۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِنِعۡمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٖ وَلَا مَجۡنُونٍ
phonetic: 52.29 Fadhakkir Famā 'Anta Bini`mati Rabbika Bikāhinin Wa Lā Majnūnin

translations.english_saheeh: So remind, [O Muḥammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore, remind (mankind of Islâmic Monotheism, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم). By the Grace of Allâh, you are neither a soothsayer, nor a madman.
translations.english_rwwad: So keep exhorting [O Prophet], for you are not, by the grace of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

arabic_text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٞ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيۡبَ ٱلۡمَنُونِ
phonetic: 52.30 'Am Yaqūlūna Shā`irun Natarabbaşu Bihi Rayba Al-Manūni

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1557]- i.e., some accident or inevitable death.

translations.english_saheeh: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time"?[1557]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or do they say: "(Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is a poet! We await for him some calamity by time!"
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await a misfortune”?

arabic_text: قُلۡ تَرَبَّصُواْ فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
phonetic: 52.31 Qul Tarabbaşū Fa'innī Ma`akum Mina Al-Mutarabbişīna

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am, with you, among the waiters."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم to them): "Wait! I am with you among the waiters!"
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “Wait, I too am waiting with you.”

arabic_text: أَمۡ تَأۡمُرُهُمۡ أَحۡلَٰمُهُم بِهَٰذَآۚ أَمۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1558]- In this expression is also a subtle allusion to the leaders of the Quraysh, who considered themselves to be great minds.

translations.english_saheeh: Or do their minds[1558] command them to [say] this, or are they a transgressing people?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Do their minds command them this [i.e. to tell a lie against you (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)] or are they people transgressing all bounds?
translations.english_rwwad: Do their minds prompt them to say such things, or are they a transgressing people?

arabic_text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥۚ بَل لَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Or do they say, "He has made it up"? Rather, they do not believe.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or do they say: "He (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has forged it (this Qur’ân)?" Nay! They believe not!
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they say, “He has made it [the Qur’an] up”? Rather, they are not willing to believe.

arabic_text: فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِحَدِيثٖ مِّثۡلِهِۦٓ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Then let them produce a statement like it, if they should be truthful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Let them then produce a recital like unto it (the Qur’ân) if they are truthful.
translations.english_rwwad: Then let them produce a discourse like this, if they are truthful.

arabic_text: أَمۡ خُلِقُواْ مِنۡ غَيۡرِ شَيۡءٍ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ
phonetic: 52.35 'Am Khuliqū Min Ghayri Shay'in 'Am Humu Al-Khāliqūna

translations.english_saheeh: Or were they created by nothing, or were they the creators [of themselves]?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Were they created by nothing? Or were they themselves the creators?
translations.english_rwwad: Were they created by none, or were they the creators [of themselves]?

arabic_text: أَمۡ خَلَقُواْ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
phonetic: 52.36 'Am Khalaqū As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđa Bal Lā Yūqinūna

translations.english_saheeh: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they have no firm Belief.
translations.english_rwwad: Or did they create the heavens and earth? Rather, they are not certain in faith.

arabic_text: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَآئِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡمُصَۜيۡطِرُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord? Or are they the controllers [of them]?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or are with them the treasures of your Lord? Or are they the tyrants with the authority to do as they like?
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they possess the treasures of your Lord, or do they have full control [of everything]?

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ سُلَّمٞ يَسۡتَمِعُونَ فِيهِۖ فَلۡيَأۡتِ مُسۡتَمِعُهُم بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٍ
phonetic: 52.38 'Am Lahum Sullamun Yastami`ūna Fīhi Falya'ti Mustami`uhum Bisulţānin Mubīnin

translations.english_saheeh: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear authority [i.e., proof].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or have they a stairway (to heaven), by means of which they listen (to the talks of the angels)? Then let their listener produce some manifest proof.
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they have a stairway [to the heaven] by which they eavesdrop? Then let those who eavesdrop produce a compelling proof.

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُ ٱلۡبَنَٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلۡبَنُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Or has He daughters while you have sons?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or has He (Allâh) only daughters and you have sons?
translations.english_rwwad: Or does He have daughters while you have sons?

arabic_text: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Or do you, [O Muḥammad], ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or is it that you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) ask a wage from them (for your preaching of Islâmic Monotheism) so that they are burdened with a load of debt?
translations.english_rwwad: Or are you asking them [O Prophet] for a reward so they find it too burdensome?

arabic_text: أَمۡ عِندَهُمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبُ فَهُمۡ يَكۡتُبُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or that the Ghaib (Unseen) is with them, and they write it down?
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they have [knowledge of] the unseen so they are writing it down?

arabic_text: أَمۡ يُرِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗاۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡمَكِيدُونَ
phonetic: 52.42 'Am Yurīdūna Kaydāan Fa-Al-Ladhīna Kafarū Humu Al-Makīdūna

translations.english_saheeh: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disbelieve - they are the object of a plan.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or do they intend a plot (against you O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)? But those who disbelieve (in the Oneness of Allâh - Islâmic Monotheism) are themselves plotted against!
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they intend a plot [against the Prophet]? But the plot of the disbelievers will rebound against themselves.

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ إِلَٰهٌ غَيۡرُ ٱللَّهِۚ سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشۡرِكُونَ
phonetic: 52.43 'Am Lahum 'Ilahun Ghayru Allāhi Subĥāna Allāhi `Ammā Yushrikūna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.52:43)
a) See the footnote (B) of (V.3:130).
b) See the footnote of (V.2:278)

translations.english_saheeh: Or have they a deity other than Allāh? Exalted is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or have they an ilâh (a god) other than Allâh? Glorified be Allâh from all that they ascribe as partners (to Him)[1]
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they have a god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah far above what they associate with Him.

arabic_text: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ كِسۡفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطٗا يَقُولُواْ سَحَابٞ مَّرۡكُومٞ
phonetic: 52.44 Wa 'In Yaraw Kisfāan Mina As-Samā'i Sāqiţāan Yaqūlū Saĥābun Markūmun

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1559]- Marking the onset of Allāh's punishment, as they had requested.

translations.english_saheeh: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling,[1559] they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if they were to see a piece of the heaven falling down, they would say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"
translations.english_rwwad: If they were to see pieces of the sky falling down, they would still say, “[This is only] a mass of clouds.”

arabic_text: فَذَرۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي فِيهِ يُصۡعَقُونَ
phonetic: 52.45 Fadharhum Ĥattá Yulāqū Yawmahumu Al-Ladhī Fīhi Yuş`aqūna

translations.english_saheeh: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -
translations.english_hilali_khan: So leave them alone till they meet their Day, in which they will sink into a fainting (with horror).
translations.english_rwwad: So leave them alone until they encounter their Day in which they will be struck down,

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ لَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُمۡ كَيۡدُهُمۡ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا هُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ
phonetic: 52.46 Yawma Lā Yughnī `Anhum Kayduhum Shay'āan Wa Lā Hum Yunşarūna

translations.english_saheeh: The Day their plan will not avail them at all, nor will they be helped.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day when their plotting shall not avail them at all nor will they be helped (i.e. they will receive their torment in Hell).
translations.english_rwwad: the Day their plots will not avail them in the least, nor will they be helped.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ عَذَابٗا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَهُمۡ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 52.47 Wa 'Inna Lilladhīna Žalamū `Adhābāan Dūna Dhālika Wa Lakinna 'Aktharahum Lā Ya`lamūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1560]- If not in this world, in the grave.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a punishment[1560] before that, but most of them do not know.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment (i.e. the torment in this world and in their graves)[2] before this; but most of them know not. (Tafsir At-Tabarî).
translations.english_rwwad: And for the wrongdoers, there will be another punishment before that, but most of them do not know.

arabic_text: وَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعۡيُنِنَاۖ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
phonetic: 52.48 Wa Aşbir Liĥukmi Rabbika Fa'innaka Bi'a`yuninā Wa Sabbiĥ Biĥamdi Rabbika Ĥīna Taqūmu

translations.english_saheeh: And be patient, [O Muḥammad], for the decision of your Lord, for indeed, you are in Our eyes [i.e., sight]. And exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord when you arise
translations.english_hilali_khan: So wait patiently (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) for the Decision of your Lord, for verily, you are under Our Eyes[3]; and glorify the Praises of your Lord when you get up from sleep.
translations.english_rwwad: Be patient [O Prophet] with your Lord’s decree, for indeed you are under Our [watchful] Eyes. And glorify the praises of your Lord when you rise.

arabic_text: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَإِدۡبَٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ
phonetic: 52.49 Wa Mina Al-Layli Fasabbiĥhu Wa 'Idbāra An-Nujūmi

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.52:49) It is said that glorifying Allâh’s Praises here means: all the five compulsory and additional Nawâfil prayers.

translations.english_saheeh: And in a part of the night exalt Him and after [the setting of] the stars.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And in the nighttime also glorify His Praises - and at the setting of the stars.[4]
translations.english_rwwad: And glorify Him at night and when the stars fade away.
